subject: Basketball
lead_paragraph: The New Mexico State freshman Herb Pope waived his right to a preliminary hearing on a drunken driving charge filed by police officers who said they found Pope passed out in a running car on a western Pennsylvania highway. The decision to waive Tuesday’s hearing means Pope will be scheduled to stand trial in Allegheny County Common Pleas Court. Officers found Pope, 19, unresponsive in the driver’s seat with the engine running in the Pittsburgh suburb of Moon Township on Dec. 28. Pope, a heralded recruit, had been academically ineligible at New Mexico State until a New Mexico judge ordered an end to the N.C.A.A. ban based on an alternative-education program he took in high school.
